intro: Arthropodium cirratum, commonly known as the native ginger or mountain ginger, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes true gingers, and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features narrow, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary spice. Arthropodium cirratum thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forested areas.
